intro: Leucheria tenuis, commonly known as the slender leucheria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to the wet tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are narrow and alternate, often covered in a fine layer of hair. Leucheria tenuis is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
